# Chord: Minor Major 7th in F# (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor Major 7th chord in F# (shape: D) consists of the notes F#-A#-C#-E#. This chord is characterized by the minor triad (root, minor third, perfect fifth) along with the major seventh interval. It creates a tension-filled yet rich and emotive sound that can add depth and complexity to a musical piece.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (root)
- A# (minor third)
- C# (perfect fifth)
- E# (major seventh)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Minor Major 7th chord in F# (shape: D) has a distinctively melancholic and mysterious quality due to the minor third and major seventh intervals. It can evoke feelings of introspection, longing, and even a touch of dissonance. This chord is commonly used in jazz, bossa nova, and other genres that require sophisticated harmonic textures. It adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to compositions.
